item.text: Expresses the sense of the Senate that President Trump should hold the government of the Russian Federation accountable for its attempts to undermine democracy in the United States and abroad and ensure that the United States is prepared to counter future attempts to interfere in its elections.
item.name: Introduced in Senate

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4744)

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents
Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.title: A resolution expressing the sense of the Senate that President Donald Trump should hold the Government of the Russian Federation accountable for its interference in the 2016 United States election and ensure that the United States is prepared to counter future attempts at election interference.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations. (text of measure as introduced: CR S4744)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
